eps.name: Shadows
eps.desc: In 1945, Peggy Carter and her SSR team raid the last known Hydra base led by Daniel Whitehall and confiscate the items that they possess, including a mysterious Obelisk. In the present, Coulson's team monitors a deal revolving around the Obelisk, which quickly goes awry when Carl Creel arrives, killing the ex-S.H.I.E.L.D. agent offering the intel, and then escaping with it. Back at the Playground, Skye interrogates Ward and learns that Hydra is using communication channels not monitored by S.H.I.E.L.D., which the team trace to discover that Hydra has simply returned to the shadows. Soon the team realizes that General Talbot is in trouble and rush to rescue him from Creel before abducting Talbot. Using Talbot's fingerprints, the team breaks into a military facility full of confiscated S.H.I.E.L.D. assets and locate the Obelisk. Agent Hartley grabs the Obelisk, which begins killing her. Skye and Triplett steal a cloak-capable quinjet and escape while May takes off on a motorcycle. Lance Hunter leaves with his team of mercenaries enlisted by S.H.I.E.L.D., only to be ambushed by Creel, who causes their car to flip, killing Agent Hartley and Idaho, and takes off with the Obelisk for an ageless Whitehall.

eps.name: Heavy Is the Head
eps.desc: After Carl Creel took off with the Obelisk, Agent Lance Hunter is left stuck in the car with Hartley and Idaho, both dead. Even though May helps him to get out, he is captured by General Talbot's men. Meanwhile, Creel absorbs the properties of the Obelisk and accidentally kills a waitress in a bar. He later meets Raina, who offers to help him but Creel refuses. Talbot tries to turn Hunter into working for him and sets him free, but Hunter returns to S.H.I.E.L.D. wanting revenge for his fallen friends. Fitz and Mack are able to build a weapon that can take Creel down. While the team is observing Creel making some deals in public, Hunter disarms the other agents and tries to kill Creel himself. But Creel easily defeats him and just when he is about to kill Hunter, Coulson takes down Creel. Coulson later offers Hunter to join the team. He then tells Talbot that he's wasting his time tracking S.H.I.E.L.D. and gives him Creel. The Obelisk is later shown in the possession of Raina and a man who is asking her to find his daughter.

eps.name: Making Friends and Influencing People
eps.desc: Coulson learns from Simmons, who is working undercover within Hydra, that their next planned target for recruitment is Donnie Gill. Ward reveals to Skye that Hydra brainwashes promising recruits such as Creel, but admits that he took all of his actions freely out of loyalty to Garrett. S.H.I.E.L.D. traces Donnie to a Hydra ship where he has killed a number of Hydra agents, but meanwhile, Hydra sends Simmons with a team to find Donnie themselves, as a test of her loyalty. Growing suspicious of the others, Fitz accidentally discovers Ward's cell, and while depriving him of oxygen as a demonstration of what he suffered, Ward confesses to him that Donnie actually already was a Hydra asset, and that the mission was really to reactivate his brainwashing. On the ship, May - who knows of Simmons' mission - shoots around her and Donnie, but allows them to escape to maintain Simmons' cover. Donnie is cornered by Hydra and re-brainwashed, but before he can leave with them, Skye shoots him with a sniper rifle. He falls into the water and freezes, but government forces are unable to locate his body. Coulson informs Fitz of Simmons' mission, while Whitehall decides to promote her despite their failure to retrieve Donnie. Later, Ward tells Skye that her father is alive and offers to bring her to him, which causes Skye to leave the room to deal with her anxiety.

eps.name: Face My Enemy
eps.desc: When a painting bearing the alien writing survives a fire at a Florida church, Coulson and May devise a mission to recover it. However, while undercover at the charity function at which it will be unveiled, they encounter Talbot. Coulson bargains with the intoxicated Talbot to obtain the painting, but when he and May inspect the storeroom, it is already gone, having been claimed by Talbot that morning. Talbot confronts Coulson and asks to meet with him in private, and Coulson agrees, but sends May to scout for traps. She discovers the brainwashed S.H.I.E.L.D. Agent 33 in Talbot's hotel room, then realizes that the Talbot at the party was actually Bakshi wearing a sophisticated disguise. Bakshi tortures May while Agent 33 disguises herself as May to pick up Coulson and sabotage the Bus. The computer virus she plants nearly causes the Bus to explode, but Fitz manages to help the others stop it. Coulson realizes that "May" is a fake because of inconsistencies in her behavior, then rescues the real May, who in turn kills Agent 33 while Bakshi escapes. S.H.I.E.L.D. claims the painting, hiding its survival from Talbot. Meanwhile, Raina attempts to book a flight to investigate the painting only to be confronted by Whitehall, who gives her an ultimatum - deliver the Obelisk to Hydra or face death.

eps.name: A Hen in the Wolf House
eps.desc: Hydra attempts to weaponize the Obelisk's power using a sample from one of its victims, but their mission partially fails. Raina begs Skye's father for help with Hydra's demands for the Obelisk, but he angrily berates her for not delivering Skye, then kills the two men who sought him out to perform an illegal surgery. Simmons's cover is discovered by Raina, who contacts Coulson and arranges a meeting at which she offers not to reveal Simmons to Hydra if Coulson allows her to take Skye to her father. Coulson refuses the offer and Simmons's identity is exposed, however, Hydra security chief Bobbi Morse is actually another undercover S.H.I.E.L.D. agent and rescues her. Coulson has Raina tagged so she can lead them to Hydra, and she discloses the location of Skye's father. Skye goes on ahead, but he is already gone. The team finds the bodies of the men murdered by Skye's father, and Skye realizes he is a monster, something that provokes rage and grief in him as he watches on a security camera. Skye resolves to help the team defeat her father and is shown the writing by Coulson, which she realizes is a map. Fitz and Simmons are reunited while Morse - revealed to be Hunter's ex-wife - joins the team. Skye's father delivers the Obelisk to Whitehall himself and offers to join forces with Hydra, aiming to kill Coulson and the rest of S.H.I.E.L.D..

eps.name: A Fractured House
eps.desc: During a United Nations meeting on S.H.I.E.L.D., Hydra agents posing as S.H.I.E.L.D. operatives attack and kill several world representatives. Senator Christian Ward, the brother of Grant Ward, decides to use this incident to propose a multinational anti-S.H.I.E.L.D. initiative. As Coulson meets Christian to proposes a win-win solution, Skye interrogates Grant about Christian. Grant explains to Skye that Christian is a master manipulator, Christian tells Coulson that this is a lie, with both S.H.I.E.L.D. agents attempting to ascertain which Ward brother is being truthful. Christian and Coulson agree to abandon the anti-S.H.I.E.L.D. proposal in exchange for Grant's transfer to Christian to stand trial, but Grant escapes while being transferred. May leads a team that attacks the Hydra agents who attacked the UN, capturing several agents, and turning them over to Talbot, who begins to agree with Coulson's mission. Meanwhile, a man enters a tattoo parlor with his body tattooed with the alien writing, and tells the artist to finish the tattoo.

eps.name: The Writing on the Wall
eps.desc: Coulson's compulsion to carve increases, and he is no longer able to sleep. When a former S.H.I.E.L.D. agent and a patient of Project T.A.H.I.T.I. is killed and her body carved with the symbols, Coulson goes back to the memory machine to find other patients who were injected with GH–325. He locks Skye in the holding cell and goes after the remaining members, trying to find an end to the madness. It turns out the writing is actually a 3D diagram of a city, a city that the alien host used to make GH–325 apparently wished to find. Seeing the completed design ends Coulson's need to carve, but since Hydra is also searching for the city, he makes it a priority for S.H.I.E.L.D. to find its location first. Meanwhile, the other members of the team try to capture Ward, who also betrays Hydra by capturing Bakshi and leaving him for S.H.I.E.L.D., before preparing to meet his brother.

eps.name: The Things We Bury
eps.desc: Odd wording used by Bakshi while being interrogated by Morse leads to the team discovering that Whitehall is actually Reinhardt, a Nazi scientist who was experimenting on the Obelisk before being captured by the S.S.R. and imprisoned for life by Peggy Carter. In 1989, Reinhardt was released from prison by Alexander Pierce, to find that a woman he had found in 1945 was still the same age. Dissecting her, Reinhardt discovered the secret to her long-life, and used it to de-age 44 years. "The Doctor" finds the remains of the woman, who was the love of his life, and vows vengeance against Whitehall, the man who he is now pretending to be aligned with. Grant Ward also appears to join in an alliance with Whitehall, after having first tortured his brother Christian into confessing pass sins, and then apparently murdering him, as well as their parents. Meanwhile, Coulson leads a team to hack a USAF mapping satellite, which they successfully use to find the hidden city. At the same time, Coulson meets "The Doctor", who knows that the Obelisk, which he calls the Diviner, is a key that must be taken to the city by someone it deems to be worthy.

eps.name: ...Ye Who Enter Here
eps.desc: The team splits up, with Coulson and Morse leading a group to begin searching for the hidden city under San Juan, and May, Skye, and Hunter leaving to help Sam and Billy Koenig rescue Raina from a Hydra attempt to kidnap her in Vancouver. Raina tells Skye that they are two of the "worthy ones" who could enter the temple in the city, and that any others who try will die. Skye tries to warn the main team, but Whitehall blocks their communications, and Ward boards the Bus to take Raina. He also takes Skye, promising to take her to her father, and in exchange agrees to let the others go. Mac has already entered the city where he touches a pattern on the floor which causes him great pain and compels him to attack the others, until he is subdued and falls down a shaft back into the city. Whitehall is surprised to learn that Ward did not destroy the Bus as ordered, and so gives Agent 33 (who still has May's face, but is now horribly disfigured) orders to do so.

eps.name: What They Become
eps.desc: May evades Hydra’s attempt to shoot down the Bus, while Ward brings Skye to meet her father. He tells her that his name is Cal, that hers is Daisy, and that Whitehall killed her mother. Whitehall then arrives at the Hydra base in San Juan where they are drilling directly into the temple. He immobilizes Cal and menaces Skye, but is interrupted as Coulson's team assaults the base. Coulson kills Whitehall, devastating Cal, who attempts to avenge the loss of his own opportunity at vengeance by trying to kill Coulson himself. Skye shoots Ward and forces Cal to leave, before following Raina and the Diviner into the temple. Agent 33, now with no purpose since Whitehall’s death, assists Ward in escaping. Coulson and Triplett race to the temple to help Skye, with Triplett making it in and Coulson being delayed by Mack. The temple closes itself, and the Diviner opens, revealing a large crystal. Skye and Raina are encased in cocoons, while Triplett is killed by the Diviner. Skye erupts out of her cocoon, her new earthquake abilities causing tremors around the city. Elsewhere, another Diviner reveals to a man with no eyes that "there's a new one".

eps.name: Love in the Time of Hydra
